snippet: The decision to leave unchanged the streaming music service’s royalties to the American Society of Composers, Authors and Publishers may lead to efforts to overhaul government music-licensing regulation.
abstract: Judge Denise L Cote of Federal District Court in Manhattan leaves unchanged royalty rate that streaming service Pandora pays songwriters; decision may fuel efforts by music groups to change decades-old government regulation over licensing.
lead_paragraph: The decision to leave unchanged the streaming music service’s royalties to the American Society of Composers, Authors and Publishers may lead to efforts to overhaul government music-licensing regulation.

headline.main: Judge Refuses to Alter Pandora’s Payments to Songwriters
headline.print_headline: Ruling Preserves Pandora’s Payments to Songwriters
